Articles.Content:
After accidentally installing an incompatible mod, KSP and other Unity games have all crashed on startup. I have tried re-installing the games and have just finished re-installing windows, but even with a fresh windows install, they still crash.

Crash Log:

Unity Player [version: Unity 5.4.0p4_b15b5ae035b7]

KERNELBASE.dll caused an Access Violation (0xc0000005)
  in module KERNELBASE.dll at 0033:9e3e3fb8.

Error occurred at 2017-11-15_151358.
D:\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\KSP_x64.exe, run by pdowd.
9% memory in use.
32728 MB physical memory [29630 MB free].
37848 MB paging file [34651 MB free].
134217728 MB user address space [134217494 MB free].

Context:
RDI:    0x00000004  RSI: 0x07950d42  RAX:   0x000002bd
RBX:    0x00000000  RCX: 0x00000000  RDX:   0xbd0003be
RIP:    0x9e3e3fb8  RBP: 0x0094ef48  SegCs: 0x00000033
EFlags: 0x00000202  RSP: 0x0094ed40  SegSs: 0x0000002b
R8:    0x0094e840  R9: 0x00000020  R10:   0x11000011
R11:    0x07cb0000  R12: 0x05e37d90  R13:   0x00000000
R14:    0x6221db20  R15: 0x00000000

Bytes at CS:EIP:
48 8b 8c 24 c0 00 00 00 48 33 cc e8 98 e6 06 00 

 

 

Any suggestions?

UPDATE: The 32 bit version of KSP works fine, but the 64 bit version is still broken.

FINALLY FIXED: Ran SFC through CMD and it repaired the corrupted dlls

Edited November 21, 2017 by knucklehead4226

While I'm not such of a good programmer, i'm pretty sure you're going to have to delete and uinstall unity. To do this just search in your searchbar for "unity" and there should be a program popping out "uinstall unity". However, to completely and surely delete it, you're going to have to delete all the registries. How you do this (you might already know) is that you need to find the "run" tab on your search bar (depending of course which Windows you have) and type "regedit", then when you're in the program, expand

HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Unity Technologies\Unity Editor, right click and delete

HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Unity\UnityEditor and again, delete it

HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Unity\WebPlayer and delete it

 

And now, install it again. Thats my suggestion I guess. I don't know if it will work or not, but its good to give it a try.

Edited November 16, 2017 by UnfortuneLess
Unity does not appear under installed programs, and there are no registry keys for unity either.
